title: ORA, GSEA and enrichment map
text: ORA performed means function ora(), requires list one gene vectors (wb), reference universe list gene sets test (gsl): GSEA performed means function gsea(), requires matrix one columns gene-related statistics (rl) list gene sets test (gsl): default, column rl sorted decreasing order.
code: ora_res <- ora(wb = wb, universe = unverse, gsl = gsl) gsea_res <- gsea(rl=rl, gsl = gsl)

title: ORA, GSEA and enrichment map
text: functions plot_ora_heatmap() plot_gsea_heatmap() draw heatmaps results ORA GSEA:
code: plot_ora_heatmap(ora_res, cluster_columns = F, cluster_rows = F, a = .5, na_col = "gold") plot_gsea_heatmap(gsea_res = gsea_res, cluster_columns = F, cluster_rows = F, a = .5, na_col = "gold")

title: ORA, GSEA and enrichment map
text: provide functions ora2enrich() gsea2enrich() obtain instances “enrichResult” class package clusterProfiler:
code: ora_enrich <- ora2enrich(ora_res, gsl = gsl, wb = wb, universe = unverse) gsea_enrich <- gsea2enrich(gsea_res, rl = rl, gsl = gsl)

title: ORA, GSEA and enrichment map
text: following procedure calculates enrichment map corresponding gene set clusters. can used, example, create visualizations gene-associated values clustered gene membership similar gene sets. procedure often called “functional clustering” gene sets defines gene functions. two required inputs : gene_set_scores: named vector gene set scores; gene_set_list: named list gene set vectors. first step calculation -pairs similarities among gene sets: function based proxy::simil() , default gene_set_sim(), uses “Simpson” similarity measure, also known overlap coefficient; list available measures can obtained using summary(proxy::pr_DB) information particular measure can shown proxy::pr_DB$get_entry("Simpson") (see ?proxy::simil() details). -pairs similarities can create corresponding enrichment map (requires gene set sizes): relevant argument min_sim (default 0.2), defines minimum threshold similarity values considered (others set zero). data frame gene sets, showing cluster, score size can retrieved using: named list gene set vectors defines gene-cluster membership can obtained :
code: gene_set_sim <- calc_gs_sim(gene_set_list) gs_size <- setNames(lengths(gene_set_list), names(gene_set_list)) em_res <- enrichment_map(gs_scores=gene_set_scores, gene_set_sim=gene_set_sim, gs_size=gs_size) gene_set_clusters_df <- get_gene_set_clusters(em_res) clust_genes <- get_cluster_genes(gene_set_clusters=gene_set_clusters_df, gene_set_list=gene_set_list)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ettore Mosca. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mosca E (2025). NPATools: Network Pathway Analysis Tools. R package version 1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {NPATools: Network and Pathway Analysis Tools},   author = {Ettore Mosca},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0}, }

title: Network and Pathway Analysis Tools
text: package contains functions : - perform network diffusion (ND) molecular networks; - obtain ND input matrix X0 gene expression data via kernel estimation; - permute vertices graph, freely, conserving vertex degree /conserving disntinct vertex subsets; - normalize adjacency matrix; - normalize ND output matrix Xs; - calculate gene set scores Xs; - create enrichment map; - perform -representation analysis (ORA); - perform gene-set enrichment analysis (GSEA); - plot heatmaps multiple ORA/GSEA runs. Documentation: https://emosca-cnr.github.io/NPATools Source code: https://github.com/emosca-cnr/NPATools

title: Network and Pathway Analysis Tools
text: use package please cite following articles: Di Nanni N, Gnocchi M, Moscatelli M, Milanesi L Mosca E, Gene relevance based multiple evidences complex networks, Bioinformatics, Volume 36, Issue 3, 1 February 2020, Pages 865–871, https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btz652 Bersanelli*, M., Mosca*, E., Remondini, D. et al. Network diffusion-based analysis high-throughput data detection differentially enriched modules. Sci Rep 6, 34841 (2016). https://doi.org/10.1038/srep34841 Chiodi , Pelucchi P, Mosca E, Cross-talk quantification molecular networks application pathway-pathway cell-cell interactions. bioRxiv (2023), https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.08.10.552776

title: Enrichment map — enrichment_map
text: enrichment_map() function calculates similarities gene-set pair using `method` metric. Subsequently,  similarities filtered maintain ones >= `min_sim`. `clustering_f` function used identify communities,   may filtered plot ones composed least `min_comp_size` gene-sets.

title: Gene Sert Enrichment Analysis — gsea
text: Gene Sert Enrichment Analysis

title: Gene Sert Enrichment Analysis — gsea
code: gsea(   rl = NULL,   gsl = NULL,   k = 99,   min_size = 5,   max_size = 500,   min_tags = 3,   abs_val = NULL,   decreasing = NULL,   BPPARAMGsl = NULL,   BPPARAMK = NULL,   description = NULL,   out_file_prefix = "gsea_res",   min.k = 50 )

title: Gene Sert Enrichment Analysis — gsea
text: rl numeric matrix genes--ranking criteria; column contains numeric values; rownames mandatory gsl named list gene sets k integer, number permutations min_size minimum gene set size max_size maximum gene set size min_tags minimum number tags consider ES; gene sets tags < min_tags excluded abs_val TRUE/FALSE vector specifies whether consider absolute values column rl; must length equal `ncol(rl)`. NULL, values considered provided decreasing TRUE/FALSE vector specifies whether order column rl decreasingly ; must length equal `ncol(rl)`. NULL, columns ranked decreasing order BPPARAMGsl number cores use parallel calculation gene set lists; total number cpu used mc_cores_path x mc_cores_perm BPPARAMK number cores use parallel calculation ranked list permutations; total number cpu used mc_cores_path x mc_cores_perm description optional named vector gene set description; names must gene seet identifiers out_file_prefix prefix .xlsx .txt output files min.k minimum number permutations obtain valid permutation-based statistics

title: Gene Sert Enrichment Analysis — gsea
text: data.frame : es, enrichment score; nes normalized enrichment score; nperm, number permutations actually used; p-value, empirical p-value; adjusted p-value, BH FDR; q_val: q-value estimnated p-values using qvalue package; FDR q-value, empirical FDR; tags, leading edge size; tags_perc, leading edge size percent gene set; list_top, rank ES; list_top_perc, rank ES percent full ranked list; lead_edge, signal strength; lead_edge_subset, gene names leading edge, # negative tags, # positive tags, positive tags ratio
